user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DirClose_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_DirClose_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_dir_table, *token);

    closedir(impl->dp);
    impl->dp = NULL;

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_DirClose_Impl:
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t OS_impl_dir_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS]
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
extern OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t OS_impl_dir_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS]
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment is an extern declaration of an array (OS_impl_dir_table) and does not define or call any function. Rule 17.2 concerns functions calling themselves directly or indirectly; this data declaration cannot create recursion. The related inline function OS_ObjectIndexFromToken simply returns a struct member and there is no recursive call chain involving OS_DirClose_Impl or the extern array.
